name: places/ChIJpZd5uFtbwokROm9FtRhLhyQ
formattedAddress: 252 Front St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 252 Front St, New York, NY 10038, USA

editorialSummary.text: Intimate, narrow eatery serving breakfast by day, plus spirits & innovative cocktails by night.

originalText.text:
Visited The Little Shop, a speakeasy bar that's been on our radar since we're big fans of hidden gems like this. The entrance is cleverly concealed behind what appears to be a convenience store, though I'm not entirely sure if the store's operational. We made reservations ahead of time, which meant no waiting around for a spot. The seating is limited, adding to the exclusive vibe, and we got a cozy sofa spot facing another group, making for a unique social setting.

The interior is snug and inviting, exactly what you'd hope for in a speakeasy. As for the drinks, the cocktails were quite good - definitely met our expectations. Overall, it was a memorable experience, blending the thrill of discovering a hidden spot with the comfort of a well-crafted drink.

originalText.text: A true authentic feel speakeasy.. can buy snacks from the from and they will plate them for you which is fun! Really small out the back but thats where the authentic vibe comes from! Cocktails were lush! A really good spot to come before dinner in the Tin Building

text.text: A true authentic feel speakeasy.. can buy snacks from the from and they will plate them for you which is fun! Really small out the back but thats where the authentic vibe comes from! Cocktails were lush! A really good spot to come before dinner in the Tin Building

originalText.text:
I recently visited The Little Shop and was blown away by the experience. The speakeasy is tucked behind a small convenience store, adding to the sense of mystery and exclusivity. Once inside, the atmosphere is electric. The dim lighting and cozy decor create a great vibe, and the music selection is always on point.

But the real standout at The Little Shop is the cocktail menu. The mixologists are true artists, crafting innovative and delicious cocktails that are as pleasing to the palate as they are to the eye. I tried a few different drinks during my visit, and each one was a total hit.

The service at The Little Shop is also top-notch. The staff are friendly and attentive, making the entire experience feel special and personalized.

Overall, I can't recommend The Little Shop enough. If you're in the mood for a unique and memorable night out, this is the place to be.

originalText.text: Very cute hidden bar! It is a small but comfy place! Drinks are quite special but tasty and recommendable! Staff were also friendly!

text.text: Very cute hidden bar! It is a small but comfy place! Drinks are quite special but tasty and recommendable! Staff were also friendly!

originalText.text: Super cool concept but lacks bar food. You can buy chips or whatever they have at front and take it with you. But I was craving wings, burgers, or something hot.

text.text: Super cool concept but lacks bar food. You can buy chips or whatever they have at front and take it with you. But I was craving wings, burgers, or something hot.
